#dim(data)

str(data)

#removing certain factors to clean data
clean<-data[!grepl("Not Resolved", data$Outcome1),]
clean<-clean[!grepl("Unknown", clean$Age_Group),]
clean<-clean[!grepl("UNKNOWN", clean$Client_Gender),]
clean<-clean[!grepl("OTHER", clean$Client_Gender),]
clean<-clean[!grepl("TRANSGENDER", clean$Client_Gender),]


names(clean)[2] <- "Date"
names(clean)[3] <- "Age"
names(clean)[4] <- "Gender"
names(clean)[5] <- "Info"
names(clean)[8] <- "PHU"


clean$Date <- as.Date(clean$Date)
clean$Month <- floor_date(clean$Date, "month")
clean$Month <- as.factor(clean$Month)

clean<- clean[,c(1:5,7:14, 6)]
names(clean)[14] <- "Outcome"

```

#have to re-run the cleaning code, else type conversion doesn't work
#clean<-data[!grepl("Not Resolved", data$Outcome1),]
#clean<-clean[!grepl("Unknown", clean$Age_Group),]
#clean<-clean[!grepl("UNKNOWN", clean$Client_Gender),]
#clean<-clean[!grepl("OTHER", clean$Client_Gender),]
#clean<-clean[!grepl("TRANSGENDER", clean$Client_Gender),]

#re-naming columns for easier coding
#names(clean)[2] <- "Date"
#names(clean)[3] <- "Age"
#names(clean)[4] <- "Gender"
#names(clean)[5] <- "Info"
#names(clean)[8] <- "PHU"
#names(clean)[14] <- "Outcome"

clean$Date <- as.Date(clean$Date)
clean$PHU <- as.numeric(clean$PHU)
clean$Age <- as.numeric(clean$Age)
clean$Gender <- as.numeric(clean$Gender)
clean$Outcome <- ifelse(clean$Outcome == "Resolved",1,0)
clean$Month <- floor_date(clean$Date, "month")
clean<- clean[,c(1:13,15,14)]

str(clean)

glmOutcome = glm(Outcome~Month+Age+Gender+PHU, clean, family=binomial)
summary(glmOutcome) #Age and Gender are good predictors of Outcome. Month is a decent predictor of outcome, but not as significant as age or gender. PHU is not a good predictor with logistic regression because there are too many data points 
```

```{r}
#Data splicing
set.seed(100)
dt = sort(sample(1:nrow(clean), nrow(clean)*.7))
#dt = sample(1:nrow(clean), size=ceiling(nrow(clean)*.7),replace=FALSE)
train<-clean[dt,]
test<-clean[-dt,]

#glmOutcomeTest = glm(Outcome~Month+Age+Gender+PHU, test, family=binomial)
#summary(glmOutcomeTest)

#Visualising decision tree
fit <- rpart(Outcome~Month+Age+Gender+PHU, train, method = 'class')
rpart.plot(fit, nn=TRUE) 
summary(fit)

#Testing the model
pred <- predict(object=fit,test[-1],type="class")
#test$Outcome <- substr(test$Outcome,1,nchar(test$Outcome)-1)
#pred <- predict(object=fit,test,type="class") 


#Calculating accuracy
t <- table(test$Outcome,pred)

#Confusion matrix
confusionMatrix(t)
```

```{r}
#train a naive bayes model
train$Outcome <- as.factor(train$Outcome)
u <- naiveBayes(Outcome~Month+Age+Gender+PHU, data=train)
preds <- predict(u, test)
x <- table(test$Outcome,pred)
confusionMatrix(x)
```
